intro: Saxifragodes, commonly known as the rockfoil, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Saxifragaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils. They are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, often showy flowers that bloom in the spring. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Saxifragodes species are generally hardy and can tolerate harsh climatic conditions.
